message:
City polls
EC rules out military deployment
Staff Correspondent
Natunbarta.com
Dhaka: Election Commissioner Md Shahnewaz Tuesday ruled out the possibility of military deployment during city corporation polls.
 
“The law enforcers that have been appointed are adequate to ensure free and fair city corporation elections. We don’t see the necessity of military deployment. The election commission has already taken necessary steps to ensure free, fair and credible polls,” said Shahnewaz.
 
This came as he was speaking to journalists at the election secretariat in Dhaka Tuesday.
 
“The candidates are smoothly carrying out their receptive election campaigns. We are yet to receive request for army deployment from any of the candidates. That’s why the election commission isn’t considering that,” said the commissioner.
 
“If a candidate fails to comply with code of conducts during campaigns, he will face legal actions. He may lose his candidacy as well,” he added.
 
Shahnewaz said steps were under way to arrange the next parliamentary election.
